title: Viewers OUTRAGED by Muslim leader who claims husbands can 'beat wives as a LAST RESORT'
text:
Before you consider any act of violence have you checked box number one which is counselling? Keysar Trad 
Defending the line, he said on Wednesday: “If you come home and you are really, really angry. We've seen many men act violently towards their woman. 
“This verse is saying really, is playing on the psychology of the man saying violence is a last resort.” 
The controversial figure added he believed men should consider buying their wives gifts before beating them as he tried to justify his beliefs. SKY NEWS The claim was made on during a broadcast on Sky News in Australia 
“Before you even consider using your hand, before you consider any act of violence have you checked box number one which is counselling?” he continued. 
“Check box number two: what does counselling entail? 
“Next time you should bring her a bunch of flowers, maybe you should bring her a box of chocolates.” SKY NEWS Keysar Trad claimed husbands should consider buying their wives gifts before violence 
Seemingly unhappy with what he had heard, host Bolt interrupted: “Maybe you should beat her if she doesn't see any sense. Beat her. That's what this says. Beat them. I'm reading the Koran” 
Mr Trad hit back: “I understand what you're saying but what I would say to you is a good person would never get to that step.” 
The comments sparked a furious backlash from viewers who took to social media to complain about the interview. 
One angry person tweeted: “Oh thank goodness. It would be so wrong to START by beating the woman. Glad it's a last resort.” 
Another fumed: “Didn't see placards protesting about beatings on Women's Rights' marches?” 
A third read: “Why is it an "option”?” Religious Festivals around the World Thu, January 12, 2017
